ygData.subject: RE: Jeweler & Research Questions/Answers
ygData.msgSnippet: Jewelcraft training question: I m thinking you can t train in a trade skill above skill level 21 regardless of level.  Here s some text from Casters Realm :
ygData.messageBody:
Jewelcraft training question:
I'm thinking you can't train in a trade skill above skill level 21
regardless of level. Here's some text from "Casters Realm":
http://eq.castersrealm.com/
<><><><>
If you start early without much money you will want to max your skill to 21
at the guild with practise points. After this you have to make items to
raise skill.
<><><><>
In other words you can't put any skill points into Jewelcraft after skill
level 21 even if you have points to spare and money.

Research training questions:
This is taken from a research info site, "Mythiran Tower":
http://www.mythiran.com/
<><><><>
Q: What's the deal with research at level 16? It only allowed me to put ONE
practice into the Research skill when I made level 16! How can I improve
this skill?

A:Sorry, folks, but at level 16 through level 18 you are only allowed that
ONE practice. Something to do with that spell circle. But never fear! Once
you break level 19 you can put 4 or 5 in there (depending upon your magic
class), then once at 20, the skies the limit...
<><><><>
Also, there is a way to practice your research w/o using real components:
http://mythiran.everquest.gamestats.com/practice.html

hope this helps,
Shawn
Bertt Earneeless, Povar

-----Original Message-----
From: Jenni [mailto:freya@...]
Sent: Monday, November 29, 1999 3:06 PM
To: eqenchanters@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqenchanters] Jeweler Questions


From: Jenni <freya@...>

Hi Bahir,

I'm also new to the list, but I might be able to help a bit with the jewlrey
questions. More feedback is welcome :)

You can add more points into your Jewlrey Craft skill after the base 21
points,
but they'll cost you. The skills list will show how much it will cost to
increase the skill (given you have points to spend on them). I personally
prefer to increase my jewlrey skill by practicing making jewlrey instead of
spending the money on skill points. That would be the reason I don't add
more
points to jewlrey anymore. My skill is still low (only at 35), but actually
making the jewlrey gives for getting the money you put into the skill back,
instead of spending the money for the points, and not seeing the money
back..
Also, as an enchanter, money for making the jewlrey (or anything else for
that
matter :) ) isn't too hard to come by if you're patient. We are the only
class that can complete the Stein of Mogguk quest easily, and the Stein is
worth quite a bit of money, (I just sold mine for 250pp). I've run this
quest
twice now, and I'm planning on doing it a few more times.

I'm not sure about the research question as I am only level 12 right now,
but I
have saved some of my practice points for research. My question is this:
Where do I find the pages for the research? after days of hunting the
dervishes in North Ro I picked up one page (24 of Tasarin's left side). Are
there any other places I might be able to pick these up quicker?

Ezrae
Dark Elf Enchantress of the 12th season
Brell Serilis



Rich Hitz wrote:

> From: Rich Hitz <Rich.Hitz@...>
>
> Hello all.
>
> I am new to the list and have Jeweling questions for you.
> My questions involves training points.
> After you spend the max 21 points at the guild and you get to your next
> level can you put those 5 into your Jewel Craft skill? Can you do this at
> each level?
> I realize you may not want to do this or advise it, but is it possible?
>
> What reasons would you give for NOT putting your training points into
Jewel
> Craft at each level, even if you only put in 1 or 2.
>
> Also, after you reach 16th, how hard is it to do research and advance it?
> Should I save points for Specialization?
>
> Thanks.
>
> --
> Bahir
> 3rd Season DE Enchanter
> Bertoxx
